Reviews.Title: “Better than average hotel”
Reviews.Author: onesmallrat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in December. Rooms were fine, but the temperature in the room was variable. Since it is not a digital thermostat, the room felt either too warm or too cold. Breakfast was okay - typical waffle, yogurt, cereal, etc. jimmy dean sausage sandwiches and store bought juice and drinks was interesting. Service was fine and pricing was comparable/cheaper to other hotels in class. Convenient to the highway and everything. About 10-15 min from downtown. could hear the Lenny's sub shop next door taking intercom orders but thankfully that ended after dinner time.

Reviews.Title: “VERY SATISFIED!”
Reviews.Author: shameka w
Reviews.Content: My husband and i came from st louis for our anniversary and wanted a reasonable stay i must say this cozy lil hotel really impressed us! the staff was very friendly it is being newly renovated the carpet is new the rooms were very clean the bed was comfortable and there were eating places like popyes,ihop,taco bell in just walking distance shopping mall and other upscale resturaunts were just a exit away which was very convienent the only thing i dont recommend is going down the other end past ihop the neihborhood doesnt look to be very nice......over all this is a very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated property near the airport”
Reviews.Author: French75
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield is a budget hotel, so taking that into account, the property at I-240 and Perkins is just fine. Even though located just off the interstate, inside the hotel it’s quiet. - no worries about road noise. The complete renovation is underway and almost finished. By the time you get here it will be. Earlier posts complained most about being old and rundown - that's been corrected! During my stay, most of the other guests were business types and airline flight people. The shuttle to the airport and back seems to operate all the time. I was warmly greeted for my 130pm “early” check-in at the front desk, with my reservation completely in order. Upgraded to a small suite, I found a room with plenty of lighting, a microwave, small fridge, coffee-maker and two new-model TVs. The sitting area also included a sofa-bed, desk with chair, coffee-table and an upholstered chair. The two TVs received all the channels including many I never heard, BUT, how annoying is it to watch old analog TV stretched to fit the screen. No one has that anymore. The free internet access worked fast and easy. There was a new super-comfy king bed made up with Marriott’s soft sheets and six pillows. The usual Fairfield continental breakfast was as expected, and also fresh and nicely presented. There is a full-service Marriott right next door. Other than that, not much nearby but fast food. Otherwise the area around seems off-track, but around the Marriotts it's completely safe. As a recently retired premier road warrior, I recommend this Fairfield and would return to it when back in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovation”
Reviews.Author: Whererwe2day
Reviews.Content: The 4th floor has completed renovations and the rooms are very nice. The internet is free and very fast. The eating options nearby are Taco Bell, Popeye's Chicken and IHOP. The staff is quite friendly and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but rundown area”
Reviews.Author: luvt2travel88
Reviews.Content: The shuttle driver and front desk staff were very efficient and friendly. The hotel is a bit rundown and shabby looking but once in the room it seemed safe. The room was small but clean. My main concern is that the area is super rundown with a shuttered fast-food restaurant next door. There was a Hampton inn and Marriott next door, both fenced in. Without a car it doesn't seem like a safe area to grab a bite to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_frank
Reviews.Content: I travel for business combined with pleasure, my wife & 5 year old always come with, we stay in hotels almost every week for 2-4 nights across the country so we have experienced the good, the bad & the ugly & we are picky within reason (hate dirt, mold & or stench). My 5-year-old takes his shoes & socks off the minute we hit the room and believe me if the carpet is a little dirty we will know within minutes (I have checked out of hotels because his feet were black with dirt). Overall this place is clean. The room did not come with microwave, or small refrigerator. Breakfast just OK 9would expect better from a F airfield)! Also has a pool OK. The front desk staff is friendly. If you need to stay in the Memphis, TN area this place is OK for a short stay, but you can do a lot better for the price. Price line gives it 21/2 stars, it's 2 star at best! The beds were very soft (mushy) would have preferred a little more support! Very noisy at 4:30 am it sounded like we were under a flight path.Although this is not considered the airport area. The area is run down and the parking lot is dark seemed OK but may prove scary for some. The hotels and some of the business's around this property had 6 foot fences surrounding their parking lots & facilities some of these were secured some were open and you could just drive in giving you one point of entrance. I am not sure of the purpose or reason!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service but Somewhat Outdated”
Reviews.Author: Rach410
Reviews.Content: My husband & stayed here for a getaway for one night. Upon arrival, the lights on the sign outside the building were not working all the way & all we could see was INN & Suites, so we passed it the first time. The young lady at the front desk was very nice & friendly & check in was fast & easy. Upon arrival to our room, we were checking things out. The gym was extrememly small with only 2 pieces of equipment. The pool was closed so we didn't see it. The carpet in the hall & our room was a little dirty looking & the room had a weird smell but was very clean. The tv was small & the pillows were even small, half the size of a normal pillow & they were so flat. The bed wasn't the most comfortable we had ever slept in, but we did sleep. The internet was fast. I kept waking up all hours of the night because of hearing people running & walking around on the floor above us. They were extremely loud. Checking out was easy & fast also & they were very nice & friendly. We didn't eat breakfast there, so I don't know how good it was. Overall, it was an good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Alot better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Kid_Dynamite
Reviews.Content: Read reviews on this site about this hotel & was reluctant on staying here. But everything was ok. I stayed here with 2 other couples during the 2010 Liberty Bowl (GO HOGS!). Staff was extremly friendly & went out of their way to help us. We had a Suite which was a 1 bathroom, living room w/flat screen tv, small bar with a stero system, couch, desk & coffee table. In the other room was a King bed & another Tv. Setup was like a studio really. Room was very nice though! Location isn't perfect if you are wanting to go downtown around Beale Street. But as a bonus, you are right off the interstate & it is probably quicker for cab drivers rather than driving down crowded streets. Mall is nearby. Most things are about 5-10 miles. Rooms were about $99. I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very old and dirty for a Marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chelsy4
Reviews.Content: The halls and elevator smelled, the carpet was very old and dirty, the shower curtain had never been cleaned (or so it seemed), the sheets didn't fit the bed, the coffee pot in the room didn't work and broke while trying to brew, the coffee in the lobby was undrinkable and the rooms felt grubby. We only stay at Marriott hotels so this came as a surprise since we always like them.

Reviews.Title: “Awesomme!!”
Reviews.Author: jedip
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to memphis to get away and try out beale street. we only go to marriotts so we found this one to be priced reasonable. the hotel has apparently gone through some type of renovations so the appearance was very updated. we stayed for 3 nights. our housekeeper made certain that we had everything we needed. and the rest of the staff was just outstanding!! upon checkin they ran out of cookies and i was hoping they had more. they didnt but the front desk clerk OFFERED to bake some more for me. i was suprised. outside of the staff and the cleanliness the security was good and tight. this hotel is a guarenteed satisfaction

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, below Fairfield standards”
Reviews.Author: C from NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield, Memphis I-240 for 2 nights during an extended cross country vacation. The location is good with very easy access from route 240 and an easy 15-20 minute drive to downtown. Compared to other Fairfields and other hotels in the same price category, we were disappointed. The hotel wasn't kept up very well. Nothing really dirty, just in need of a remodel. The shower didn't drain properly, the mattress was poor, and the entire hotel had a bit of a dingy feel. The TV's color was mis-adjusted and there was no way to fix it, even with a request to the front desk, and not all towels were replaced when the room was made up. There were some positives. The free breakfast was better than average, and the free wireless Internet service worked very well. Also, with the exception of one person who checked us in, the help was always friendly. The person who checked us in was terrible. As he was checking us in he was ranting about how much he hates Memphis and can't wait until he can leave. This is our first visit to Memphis, so his "welcome to Memphis" ws odd at best. Hopefully he'll get his wish, and find work in a non-service industry. (Note: This didn't effect my overall rating since it was one bad egg, who most likely won't be there long.) Overall, although we like Fairfield's in general, we wouldn't recommend this hotel. You can find other offerings for a better overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “This place was okay”
Reviews.Author: TinaLou
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this property and found it to be suitable. The room decor was nice, but the level of cleanliness was a bit below par (although not disgustingly horrible). The high-speed internet worked flawlessly. We were traveling with two children, so we spent time at the pool. The chlorine level was excessive and there were no lounge chairs, which we found to be odd considering it is an outdoor pool. Upon inquiring, we were told that the hotel was under new management that had been brought in to rescue the property from a period of disarray. Lounge chairs were scheduled to be added within a few days. The new hotel manager was always around and seemed to be very involved in putting the property back on the right track. The exercise facilities were well-equiped, however the airconditioning was out in that room, making it uncomfortable in the summer heat. The best and most redeeming quality of our stay was the complimentary breakfast. We expected cereal, bagels, and muffins and were pleasantly surprised to find a much more extensive menu. They had buiscuits and sausage gravy, homemade self-serve waffles, microwave breakfast sandwiches, yogurts, peanut butter, fresh fruits, juices, pastries, poptarts, etc. It was AWESOME, especially when traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tourwriter
Reviews.Content: We asked for a room on the top floor, with King bed, Non- smoking, and quiet. That was exactly what we received and more! From the minute we walked in we were treated with smiles, courtesy, and efficiency. The desk clerks, Terry & Shannon, were spectacular. We asked for information about restaurants and were given excellent choices plus printed out directions on each one. Our room was very clean and kept exactly as we wished throuhout our stay. The manager was very pleased to hear that we enjoyed our stay and said they have been doing everything possible to change their previous poor reviews. They have accomplished this and the Marriott Corporation should be proud of this hotel and in particular, it's staff!

Reviews.Title: “I would not return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nub2travel
Reviews.Content: The room left alot to be desired. Lumpy bed no clock in the room. Thin walls and gross looking carpet. We checked out the very next morning and moved to a nearby Marriott for the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Live Roaches and Heavy Extermination Spray”
Reviews.Author: mrs1140
Reviews.Content: We checked in late, 10 pm, and noticed a peculiar odor in the hallways. Upon reaching the room, we found a live roach in the bathtub. We would have left, but my husband was totally exhausted from 12 hrs of driving. Our friends did warn us to avoid staying in Memphis but.... We had to sleep breathing in the extermination spray fumes. Upon checkout, I complained to the desk clerk and he said he'd pass it onto maintenance. I guess this Fairfield is owned by Showcase - not Marriott management. If so, Marriott should remove their association with this site.
